Ollama Response: Derek's behavior is quite suspicious, especially since he was spotted near George’s body last night. It seems risky for him to remain silent about his whereabouts at that time. I would lean towards executing Derek because if he has something to hide, like being the werewolf or having an alibi problem, it might come out sooner rather than later.
Philip: Derek's behavior is quite suspicious, especially since he was spotted near George’s body last night. It seems risky for him to remain silent about his whereabouts at that time. I would lean towards executing Derek because if he has something to hide, like being the werewolf or having an alibi problem, it might come out sooner rather than later.
Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). are:GGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGG\nEmma: <think>\nOkay, let\'s see. The user provided a really long and complex query that seems to be a mix of different elements. First, there\'s a role-playing scenario involving a game with characters like George, Sarah, Derek, etc., and it\'s Day 3, Night 3. The user wants a response from a player\'s perspective, reacting to recent discussions, mentioning the top suspect, and not revealing their exact role.\n\nI need to make sure I understand the context. The game state mentions that George died last night, and the other characters are alive. It\'s the third day and night, so maybe it\'s a game like "Werewolf" or a similar social deduction game where players have roles and need to deduce who the werewolf or other roles are.\n\nThe user\'s message includes a private info hint of "none," so I can\'t use that. The response should be 1-2 sentences, reacting to points from the discussion, suggesting who to execute, and not revealing their role. The example response the user provided was a concise message from a player, so I need to follow that structure.\n\nI should check if there are any specific clues in the recent discussion that the user mentioned. Since the user hasn\'t provided the actual discussion points, I might need to make some assumptions based on common game mechanics. For example, if George was the last to die, maybe someone is suspected of being the werewolf or a traitor. The top suspect could be someone who had opportunities or motives, like Derek or Talia.\n\nBut since the user hasn\'t provided specific details about the discussion, I should keep the response general but plausible. The response should also avoid giving away the player\'s role. Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Maria (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nSarah: I agree that Enrique\'s behavior is concerning, but I\'m also wary of the Poisoner\'s potential interference with the Fortune Teller\'s results. are:GGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGG\nEmma: <think>\nOkay, let\'s see. The user provided a really long and complex query that seems to be a mix of different elements. First, there\'s a role-playing scenario involving a game with characters like George, Sarah, Derek, etc., and it\'s Day 3, Night 3. The user wants a response from a player\'s perspective, reacting to recent discussions, mentioning the top suspect, and not revealing their exact role.\n\nI need to make sure I understand the context. The game state mentions that George died last night, and the other characters are alive. It\'s the third day and night, so maybe it\'s a game like "Werewolf" or a similar social deduction game where players have roles and need to deduce who the werewolf or other roles are.\n\nThe user\'s message includes a private info hint of "none," so I can\'t use that. The response should be 1-2 sentences, reacting to points from the discussion, suggesting who to execute, and not revealing their role. The example response the user provided was a concise message from a player, so I need to follow that structure.\n\nI should check if there are any specific clues in the recent discussion that the user mentioned. Since the user hasn\'t provided the actual discussion points, I might need to make some assumptions based on common game mechanics. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). 	margin: 0;
	padding: 0;

	margin-left: 15px;
	padding: 10px;
	padding-left: 100px;
	background: url('/squid-internal-static/icons/SN.png') no-repeat left;

	color: #000000;
}

	color: #000000;
}

/* special event: FTP success page titles */

	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;
}

/* Page displayed body content area */
#content {
	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;
}

/* General text */
p {
}

/* error brief description */
#error p {
}

/* some data which may have caused the problem */
#data {
}

/* the error message received from the system or other software */
#sysmsg {
}

pre {
}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */
#dirmsg {
    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

/* horizontal lines */
hr {
	margin: 0;
}

/* page displayed footer area */
#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;
}

:lang(fa) { direction: rtl; font-size: 100%; font-family: Tahoma, Roya, sans-serif; float: right; }
:lang(he) { direction: rtl; }

</head><body id=ERR_READ_TIMEOUT>

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Emma. Ollama Response: To decide whether I should vote YES or NO on the execution of Sarah, I need to consider my role as Philip and the current information available:

1. **Role**: My exact role is unknown, but I am aware that certain roles have specific knowledge and actions. Since my actions are limited during the day (outside of potentially being the Mayor), it's crucial to analyze who might be a threat or an ally.

2. **Imp (Evil)**: The primary goal for GOOD players is to identify and eliminate the Imp, as their survival leads to an EVIL win condition. During discussions, I should pay attention to any statements that align with behaviors typical of an Imp—such as deflecting suspicion away from themselves or attempting to mislead other players.

3. **Information Gathering**: My current knowledge consists of:
   - The list of alive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria.
   - Potential roles for each player based on known alignments (GOOD, EVIL) and the ability to execute certain actions.
   
4. **Behavior Analysis**: Observing how players have interacted so far might provide hints about their roles:
   - Has Sarah been pushing for any particular narrative or trying to shift blame onto others?
   - Does she exhibit behavior that aligns with someone who knows they are an EVIL player, such as attempting to create division within the town?

5. **Strategic Considerations**: 
   - If Sarah is executed and it turns out she was NOT the Imp, then I risk reducing our GOOD numbers unnecessarily.
   - However, if there's a strong indication or suspicion that Sarah could be the Imp, executing her would align with the primary goal of eliminating EVIL threats.

6. **Allies and Threats**: 
   - Consider players who may have roles like Empath or FortuneTeller, as they might provide insights during discussions.
   - Pay attention to those who seem particularly aligned with protecting Sarah—this could indicate she has a GOOD role that benefits from her survival.

7. **Butler's Influence**: As an Outsider, the Butler can influence voting but only follows their MASTER's lead. If I suspect the Butler is targeting me or influencing others towards YES/NO, it might skew the decision process.

8. **Final Decision**:
   - Given that my role isn't explicitly known, and without direct evidence pointing to Sarah as the Imp (like a failed FortuneTeller attempt), caution is advised.
   - If there are no strong indicators of her being EVIL, executing her could harm our chances if she's a key GOOD player.

Based on this reasoning and in the absence of clear evidence against Sarah, I will vote NO.

State who you'd execute today and why.\n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: None\n- Alive (others): Derek, Emma, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria\n- Day 4, Night 4\n\nYour private info hint: Fortune Teller: NO for [Derek, Philip].\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Derek (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nSarah: I'm a bit concerned that Emma didn't say who they would execute, which is unusual for them. Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Emma (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nSarah: I\'m a bit concerned that Emma didn\'t say who they would execute, which is unusual for them. As for who I\'d execute today, I think it should be Talia - their lack of input and seeming absence from discussions make me wary.\nDerek: are using an example in a as are... Ollama Response:  The user is asking for help in writing a Chinese response as a player in a game, possibly similar to Among Us. The user provided a sample response in Chinese, which suggests they want a similar response reacting to the game state and discussing suspicions without revealing their role.

The game state provided includes the players Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria, with no deaths reported yet (Day 4, Night 4). The user wants a concise Chinese response that reacts to points from the recent discussion, suggests executing a suspect, and explains why without giving away their role.

Here's a possible Chinese response:

我注意到Talia和Anika昨晚行动频繁，但没有直接证据。目前最可疑的是Philip，因为他曾试图转移讨论焦点。如果必须执行，我会优先调查他，因为他可能在隐瞒什么。

Translation: I noticed that Talia and Anika were active last night, but there's no direct evidence. Currently, Philip seems the most suspicious because he tried to divert the conversation. If we have to execute someone, I will prioritize investigating him because he might be hiding something.

Here's a possible Chinese response:

我注意到Talia和Anika昨晚行动频繁，但没有直接证据。目前最可疑的是Philip，因为他曾试图转移讨论焦点。如果必须执行，我会优先调查他，因为他可能在隐瞒什么。

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. **Game State:**

- **Last Night's Death:** None
- **Alive (Others):** Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria
- **Time:** Day 4, Night 4

**Hints and Strategy:**
1. React to recent discussions by mentioning suspicious actions or attempts to divert conversations.
2. Express willingness to execute the most suspicious player without revealing personal roles.
3. Maintain a concise response (1–2 sentences).

This approach helps you engage with other players while keeping your role concealed, adhering to game dynamics similar to "Among Us."

---

**Game State:**

- **Last Night's Death:** None
- **Alive (Others):** Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria
- **Time:** Day 4, Night 4

**Hints and Strategy:**
1. React to recent discussions by mentioning suspicious actions or attempts to divert conversations.
2. Express willingness to execute the most suspicious player without revealing personal roles.
3. Maintain a concise response (1–2 sentences).

This approach helps you engage with other players while keeping your role concealed, adhering to game dynamics similar to "Among Us."

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. Without any deaths reported yet, it makes sense we keep an eye on him; there might be something he isn't telling us.

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies).
